thread.title: Green Room Communications Celebrates 10-Year Anniversary; Relocates Growing Business to Parsippany, New Jersey

author: cnbc.com
title: Green Room Communications Celebrates 10-Year Anniversary; Relocates Growing Business to Parsippany, New Jersey

organizations.name: managing partner of green room communications

text:
PARSIPPANY, N.J., Green Room Communications, a healthcare communications agency focused on public relations, corporate communications, creative design, media strategy and advocacy relations, celebrates its 10-year anniversary this year. In commemoration of this milestone, the company has also announced its relocation to a new address, 1719 Route 10 East, Suite 318, in Parsippany. Located within the state's pharmaceutical corridor, the new office is convenient to many of its healthcare clientele and allows for the company's continued expansion.
"Green Room has grown exponentially in terms of revenue, size and clientele as we have solidified our business model," said Deborah Fowler, Managing Partner of Green Room Communications. "Our new location is ideal for building on this growth while evolving to meet business needs."
Green Room Communications was designed to meet the unique needs of the healthcare industry through strategic, integrated communications services empowering clients to communicate about company strategy, scientific data, products, services and therapeutic areas both internally and externally.
"Communications permeates every level of an organization and touches all stakeholder audiences. Green Room has transformed to reflect the shifting needs of our healthcare clientele who seek a skill-based and nimble approach," said Karen Carolonza, Managing Partner of Green Room Communications. "Strategic communications directly impact business objectives and have emerged as a critical function in today's complex multimedia world."
Green Room was named a WBENC-Certified Women's Business Enterprise in March 2016 by the Women's Business Enterprise National Council (WBENC). Green Room is passionate about making a difference in the lives of patients and about the charities it supports, including Mary's Place by the Sea, The Progeria Research Foundation and Soft Bones: The US Hypophosphatasia Foundation.
